text: William Holms (27 August 1866 - 30 September 1950) is a former Scotland international rugby union player.http://en.espn.co.uk/scotland/rugby/player/747.html ==Rugby Union career== ===Amateur career=== Holms started his rugby union career playing for Blair Lodge.https://www.britishnewspaperarchive.co.uk/viewer/bl/0001964/18851229/035/0003 He was captain of the side in 1884.https://www.britishnewspaperarchive.co.uk/viewer/bl/0000540/18841013/122/0003 He was picked for Scotland and noted as a Blair Lodge player initially for the Ireland match in February 1886 - but by the time the match came around he was already snapped up by London Scottish and was previously listed as a London Scottish player in the Wales match in January 1886.https://www.britishnewspaperarchive.co.uk/viewer/bl/0000453/18860108/032/0002 However he was noted as being unable to play and his place went to Alexander Stephen of West of Scotland.https://www.britishnewspaperarchive.co.uk/viewer/bl/0001964/18860219/041/0003 He played for London Scottish in March 1886https://www.britishnewspaperarchive.co.uk/viewer/bl/0001055/18860301/067/0004 and December 1886https://www.britishnewspaperarchive.co.uk/viewer/bl/0001964/18861224/065/0003 and March 1887.https://www.britishnewspaperarchive.co.uk/viewer/bl/0000162/18870307/052/0004 It was noted that Holms had a particular skill in kicking drop goals in the side, which only his teammate George Campbell Lindsay could equal in England.https://www.britishnewspaperarchive.co.uk/viewer/bl/0001964/18870226/032/0002 He played rugby union for RIE College.Scotland. The Essential History of Rugby Union. Nick Oswald and John Griffiths. Headline Book Publishing. 2003 In 1888 and 1889 he played for Clydesdale.https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=qVlEAAAAIBAJ&sjid;=87EMAAAAIBAJ&pg;=3586%2C5487123https://www.britishnewspaperarchive.co.uk/viewer/bl/0001965/18890126/084/0005 In the 1888 to 1889 season he moved to Edinburgh and played for Edinburgh Wanderers.https://www.britishnewspaperarchive.co.uk/viewer/bl/0000162/18881029/053/0004https://www.britishnewspaperarchive.co.uk/viewer/bl/0000452/18881207/122/0004https://www.britishnewspaperarchive.co.uk/viewer/bl/0000269/18890129/046/0004https://www.britishnewspaperarchive.co.uk/viewer/bl/0001965/18890112/078/0006 ===Provincial career=== In 1888, he was capped by Glasgow District for their inter-city match against Edinburgh District.https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=qVlEAAAAIBAJ&sjid;=87EMAAAAIBAJ&pg;=3586%2C5487123 This was despite Clydesdale asking Glasgow District not to consider their players as they were due to play the Leeds St John club on the same day in Leeds.https://www.britishnewspaperarchive.co.uk/viewer/bl/0002703/18881212/038/0002 In 1889 he played for West of Scotland District.https://www.britishnewspaperarchive.co.uk/viewer/bl/0001965/18890126/084/0005 ===International career=== He was capped 6 times for Scotland between 1886 and 1889.http://en.espn.co.uk/statsguru/rugby/player/747.html?class=1;template=results;type=player;view=match ==Cricket career== He went to Blair Lodge School in Polmont. He played cricket for the school; and a match made The Sporting Life newspaper when the schoolboys played the masters in 1883. Holms performed well as a bowler, bowling out 3 teachers. He also caught W. A. Bettesworth, the first master to bat, but only after Bettesworth had scored a 96. Although Holms was second up to bat for the schoolboys he was bowled out lbw after scoring only 5 runs.https://www.britishnewspaperarchive.co.uk/viewer/bl/0000893/18830521/056/0004 The School team played well that summer with victories over Dunfermline and Edinburgh Academy - with Holms in the side.https://www.britishnewspaperarchive.co.uk/viewer/bl/0000893/18830625/072/0004 He played for Glasgow Cricket club; and was second in their batting averages in 1889, just behind A. G. G. Asher. The team also included such dual rugby union and cricket players:- Frank Hunter, Leslie Balfour-Melville, Andrew Ramsay Don-Wauchope, Thomas Roger Marshall and Henry Stevenson.https://www.britishnewspaperarchive.co.uk/viewer/bl/0001965/18890809/052/0006 He was also playing for the Edinburgh club Grange in that same year.https://www.britishnewspaperarchive.co.uk/viewer/bl/0000295/18890617/060/0003https://www.britishnewspaperarchive.co.uk/viewer/bl/0000697/18890615/162/0009 The Blair Lodge cricket club got their facts wrong in 1896 and were corrected by the Edinburgh Evening News. Blair Lodge C.C. had claimed that their 302 scored against Glenalmond was a record. The newspaper went on to list times where 302 was exceeded. It did then list the Scottish records that Blair Lodge did hold, including a 557 for 4 wickets against Campsie Glen in 1884. In this match, Holms scored the largest score held by a schoolboy at cricket - 303 not out. This was still the record in June 1896.https://www.britishnewspaperarchive.co.uk/viewer/bl/0000452/18960619/076/0005 ==Other sports== In 1885, he won the 100 yards sprint in the Blair Lodge Sports Day with a time of 10.5 seconds; and he won the quarter-mile race in 56 seconds; and the 300 yards handicap race in 32.5 seconds. He won the long jump and was second in the shot putt.https://www.britishnewspaperarchive.co.uk/viewer/bl/0000986/18850331/031/0005 In 1886 he was at the RIE College at Coopers Hill. He entered their Sports Day. At the time of print of The Sporting Life newspaper Holms had won his heat for the 100 yards dash and was favourite for the final, clocking a time of 11 seconds with newspaper noting the simple phrase won easily.https://www.britishnewspaperarchive.co.uk/viewer/bl/0000893/18860518/048/0004 ==Civil Service career== He worked in the Indian Civil Service. He was awarded the CIE; the Companion class of the Order of the Indian Empire.https://www.geni.com/people/William-Holms/6000000024193522776 ==References== Category:1866 births Category:Scottish rugby union players Category:Scotland international rugby union players Category:RIE College RFC players Category:Indian Civil Service (British India) officers Category:Clydesdale RFC Glasgow rugby union players Category:Glasgow District players Category:West of Scotland District players Category:1950 deaths Category:London Scottish F.C. players Category:Edinburgh Wanderers RFC players Category:Grange cricketers
